title: Community Care Manpower Development Award (CCMDA)

application.raw: Applications are accepted throughout the year.

blurb:
CCMDA aims to support the attraction, development and retention of manpower in the Community Care sector. It covers short courses, formal academic programmes and attachments to local or overseas healthcare and Community Care facilities.
It also provides training support to Genera

title: Community Care Nursing Leadership Programme (CCNLP)

application.raw: CCNLP applications are open throughout FY, i.e. FY20-FY26.

snippets: The Community Care Nursing Leadership Programme (CCNLP) is a talent development programme which aims to build nursing leadership bench-strength for the Community Care sector, offering a structured pathway for senior nurses to grow into leadership roles. Depending on their stage of career, these senior nurses can be placed on two different tracks in building their competencies: Three-Year Track for Nurse Managers (NMs) or equivalent who are able to assume leadership roles sooner and address more immediate gaps in succession planning; and Five-Year Track for Senior Staff Nurses (SSNs) or equivalent with a longer career and leadership runway. To facilitate the nursing talents’ career development, senior nurses placed on the CCNLP can look forward to various clinical training programmes, leadership development programmes and attachments. In addition, there will be executive coaching, networking and peer learning sessions to enhance support for these senior nurses to transit into new leadership roles. The Ministry of Health (MOH) and AIC will also work with participating Community Care Organisations (CCOs) to develop an Individual Development Plan (IDP) to track the development and progression of these nursing talent, in accordance to the Community Nursing Competency Framework (CNCF). Who Can Apply? Community Care Organisations can apply for their nominated local Registered Nurses (Nurse Managers or Senior Staff Nurses) who completed at least one year of continuous service with them and meet the eligibility criteria below: Be a Singapore Citizen or Singapore Permanent Resident; Be a Registered Nurse (RN) with at least five years of nursing experience working in public healthcare institutions, private hospitals or Community Care sector; Possess strong clinical skills and nursing experience; Prior experience in the Community Care sector or demonstrated interest to serve in the community; and Demonstrate potential to become a nursing leader in the Community Care sector. Eligible individuals local RNs can self-apply by submitting CCNLP application to ccnlp@aic.sg for AIC’s review first. AIC will then work with applicant on their application process. When to Apply? CCNLP applications are open throughout FY, i.e. FY20-FY26. How much funding can you receive? CCOs will be funded expenses relating to clinical training and local/ overseas attachments for each nursing talent’s developmental track under the programme. CCNLP Funding Grant Three-Year Track Five-Year Track Clinical Training per Nursing Talent $12,000 $20,000 Attachments per Nursing Talent $22,000 $22,000 Funding Grant per Nursing Talent $34,000 $42,000

blurb: The Community Care Nursing Leadership Programme (CCNLP) is a talent development programme which aims to build nursing leadership bench-strength for the Community Care sector, offering a structured pathway for senior nurses to grow into leadership roles. Depending on their stage o

title: Productivity and Digitalisation Grant (PDG)

snippets: The Productivity and Digitalisation Grant (PDG) is a resource support under the Community Care Digital Transformation Plan (CCDTP). It aims to support Community Care Organisations to adopt technology as part of their digitalisation journey to improve productivity and optimise manpower; enable better care and stronger care integration; and support sector transformation. It provides co-funding to defray cost of implementing technology solutions that are aligned to the Technology Directory Roadmap and able to demonstrate its application in the following domains: Productivity and digitalisation focus Impact to organisation Capabilities of organisation to execute project Sustainability of the project For more details on the CCDTP and Technology Directory Roadmap, click here . Eligibility This grant is open to organisations that provide community care services in line with MOH’s licensing or service requirements. The project shall be for its centre that operates in Singapore. Funding Quantum Eligible grant applicant may receive funding of up to 85% of the approved costs, capped at a certain amount, depending on the type of technology category. Application Process You may submit the online application form throughout the year. Kindly submit one application per project and preferably, one project per centre.

blurb:
The Productivity and Digitalisation Grant (PDG) is a resource support under the Community Care Digital Transformation Plan (CCDTP).
It aims to support Community Care Organisations to adopt technology as part of their digitalisation journey to improve productivity and optimise man

title: Tote Board Better Health Fund (TBBHF)

application.raw: Applications are accepted throughout the year and project can only commence two (2) months after approval from Evaluation Panel (EP) has been obtained. The application closing and EP meeting dates are as follows:

snippets: The Tote Board Better Health Fund (TBBHF) is a seed fund to pilot innovative programmes with a potential to scale within the community care sector. There are three key priorities under TBBHF: Care and Support, Care Integration and Emerging Areas. Care and Support – To empower individuals and expand the range of approaches that allow them to age healthily and well. Care Integration – To strengthen care services and enable the community in achieving a seamless continuum of care for clients. Emerging Areas – To energise the ecosystem to be future-ready in addressing emerging priorities and gaps. Click here for more information on TBBHF. Who Can Apply? To be eligible for TBBHF, the applicant must be one of the following organisations or institution: Co-operatives Non-Profit Organisations (Companies Limited by Guarantee, Charity Trusts and Societies) / Social Service Agencies Social Enterprises which are members of the Singapore Centre for Social Enterprise (raiSE) Government Agencies Regional Healthcare Systems Public Healthcare Institutions Grassroots Organisations Private service providers that serve subsidised clients (e.g. private nursing homes on portable subsidy) AND the applicant has General Reserves of not more than three years of Total Operating Expenditure. When to Apply? Applications are accepted throughout the year and project can only commence two (2) months after approval from Evaluation Panel (EP) has been obtained. The application closing and EP meeting dates are as follows: Application Closing Evaluation Panel (EP) meeting conducted in 31 March July 31 July November 30 November March of following year How much funding can you receive? TBBHF funds projects based on a quarterly reimbursement basis, at up to 90% of supported costs. Funding Criteria Funding Quantum Programme serves an unmet need and uses a new method or approach which aims to achieve transformative impact in the landscape. 90% of supported costs. Programme serves an unmet need and is an existing service model rolled out to a new target group. 70% of supported costs.

Applications are accepted throughout the year and project can only commence two (2) months after approval from Evaluation Panel (EP) has been obtained. The application closing and EP meeting dates are as follows:

blurb:

title: Community Integration Fund
agency: Ministry of Culture, Community and Youth

application.raw: The CIF is open for applications throughout the year. Applications should be submitted at least 8 weeks before the project start date.

snippets: The Community Integration Fund (CIF) was launched by the National Integration Council (NIC) in September 2009 to support organisations in implementing ground-up initiatives which promote local-foreign integration. Projects should satisfy at least one of the following objectives to be considered for CIF funding: Provide information and resources on Singapore Encourage social interaction between locals, immigrants and foreigners Encourage emotional attachment to and involvement in Singapore Promote a positive mindset towards integration Who can apply? Singapore-registered organisations, including companies and trade unions may apply for CIF. Individuals should apply through a registered organisation if they wish to apply for the CIF. More details on eligibility are available in the grant guidelines . When can I apply? The CIF is open for applications throughout the year. Applications should be submitted at least 8 weeks before the project start date. How much funding can you receive? Successful applicants can receive up to 80% of supported project expenditure, capped at $100,000, on a reimbursement basis.
The CIF is open for applications throughout the year. Applications should be submitted at least 8 weeks before the project start date.

blurb: The Community Integration Fund (CIF) was launched by the National Integration Council (NIC) in September 2009 to support organisations in implementing ground-up initiatives which promote local-foreign integration. Projects should satisfy at least one of the following objectives t

title: Coach Development Grant

application.raw: Coach Development Grant is open for applications throughout the year. Applications should be submitted at least 2 months before the start of your proposed development activity.

snippets: The Coach Development Grant (CDG) provides financial assistance to individual sports coaches and coach developers who wish to upgrade their coaching knowledge and skills via attending coaching attachments, conferences, short-term courses, workshops and seminars as well as obtaining a Degree or Diploma, both locally and overseas. Who can apply? Coaches who are registered with the National Registry of Coaches (NROC). More details on eligibility are available in the grant guidelines . When can I apply? Coach Development Grant is open for applications throughout the year. Applications should be submitted at least 2 months before the start of your proposed development activity. How much funding can you receive? Successful applicants can receive up 75% of funding costs for Singapore citizens and up to 25% for foreigners, determined based on your NROC membership level.
Coach Development Grant is open for applications throughout the year. Applications should be submitted at least 2 months before the start of your proposed development activity.

blurb: The Coach Development Grant (CDG) provides financial assistance to individual sports coaches and coach developers who wish to upgrade their coaching knowledge and skills via attending coaching attachments, conferences, short-term courses, workshops and seminars as well as obtaini

title: Enterprise Innovation and Capability Development Grant (InnoGrant)

application.raw: Grant is open for application throughout the year.

snippets: Sport Singapore's enhanced Enterprise Innovation and Capability Development Grant (InnoGrant) is designed to catalyse the development of stronger growth engines within Singapore's sport and fitness industry. The grant offers financial support of up to S$1,000,000 per project. The objectives of the InnoGrant are to: Build capability and/or capacity of enterprise in the development and application of technology and/or innovation solutions to the sport and fitness industry; Enable sport and fitness as a platform to encourage and stimulate collaborative research and development with adjacent industries; and Surface innovative ideas/solutions that have the potential to be new growth engine(s) for sport and fitness industry Please refer to Sport Singapore’s website for more information. Who can apply? Sport & fitness organisations in the following categories: Academies & Clubs (A&Cs) Event Organisers & Event Management Companies (EOs/EMCs) Equipment & Apparel Fitness & Wellness Facilities Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs) Media & Broadcasting National Sports Association (NSAs) Sport Facilities Or Enterprises in adjacent industries pursuing technology solutions that are sport-related or have applicability to sport. When can I apply? Grant is open for application throughout the year. How much funding can you receive? Successful applicants can receive up to $1,000,000.

blurb:
Sport Singapore's enhanced Enterprise Innovation and Capability Development Grant (InnoGrant) is designed to catalyse the development of stronger growth engines within Singapore's sport and fitness industry. The grant offers financial support of up to S$1,000,000 per project.
The

title: Enhanced Fund-raising Programme

application.raw: Submit your application at least 30 days before the actual event date of your fund-raising project. If there is no physical event, the actual event date should be the same as the project start date.

snippets: This grant is open to charities whose fund-raising projects have well-defined outcomes and support any of the following of Tote Board’s strategic objectives: Healthy Lives Empowered Vulnerable Groups Cohesive Society Liveable Home Please refer to Enhanced Fund-Raising Programme webpage for the details of the EFR Programme and its Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs). When to apply? Submit your application at least 30 days before the actual event date of your fund-raising project. If there is no physical event, the actual event date should be the same as the project start date. How to apply? Complete and submit the online form. All fields are mandatory unless otherwise stated. The application should take about 30-45 minutes to complete with all the information on hand. Things to note During claim submission, you’ll need to submit the following accordingly. For physical fund-raising events Photos of the actual event on site. For digital fund-raisers Screenshots of the project-specific campaign page, capturing the website address and project-specific campaign title (indicated in the approved application) of the relevant web pages.

blurb:
This grant is open to charities whose fund-raising projects have well-defined outcomes and support any of the following of Tote Board’s strategic objectives:
Healthy Lives
Empowered Vulnerable Groups
Cohesive Society
Liveable Home
Please refer to Enhanced Fund-Raising Programme w

title: General Project Grant

snippets: This grant is open to non-profit organisations, corporate organisations, or social enterprises who are unable to find a suitable partner fund to support the project. The project must fulfil one or more of Tote Board's Strategic Outcomes: Healthy Lives Empowered Vulnerable Groups Cohesive Society Liveable Home How to apply? Complete this application form to apply for the Tote Board General Project Grant. Applications must be received by Tote Board within 3-6 months before the commencement of the project. Applicants are encouraged to submit their applications as early as possible. Completing the grant application should take about 30-45 mins with all the information on hand. All fields are mandatory unless otherwise stated. Some fields may not be applicable to your project. Please indicate ‘NA’ in the fields accordingly.

Complete this application form to apply for the Tote Board General Project Grant. Applications must be received by Tote Board within 3-6 months before the commencement of the project. Applicants are encouraged to submit their applications as early as possible. Completing the grant application should take about 30-45 mins with all the information on hand. All fields are mandatory unless otherwise stated. Some fields may not be applicable to your project. Please indicate ‘NA’ in the fields accordingly.

blurb:

title: Lively Places Fund

application.raw: The Project Fund and Building Fund are open for applications throughout the year. Application should be submitted at least 8 weeks before the project start date. For MSCP Rooftop Gardening Proposals, applications are open from: March – April; and September – October

snippets: The Lively Places Fund (LPF) aims to support community-led efforts in enlivening Singapore's public spaces. Under this programme, you can organise activities in public spaces and streets that bring communities together, or create installations that enliven our public spaces. LPF comprises the Project Fund, Building Fund, and MSCP Rooftop Gardening Proposals. You can also check out past grant projects and guidelines . Who can Apply? The following are eligible to apply: a) Singaporeans; b) Singapore permanent residents; c) Merchants association; d) Residents' committee/network; e) Schools; f) Non-profit organisations *Submissions must be made by Singapore Citizens/ Permanent Residents aged above 17 years. *Submission of proposals by government agencies and/or Town Councils on behalf of community stakeholders will not be accepted. When to apply? The Project Fund and Building Fund are open for applications throughout the year. Application should be submitted at least 8 weeks before the project start date. For MSCP Rooftop Gardening Proposals, applications are open from: March – April; and September – October How much funding can you receive? For Project Fund and Building Fund proposals, successful applicants can receive 100% funding for project expenditure, capped at $20,000. Projects that are activity-based would be subjected to a 25% grant on outsourced manpower costs and 20% grant cap on F&B and prizes. For MSCP Rooftop Gardening Proposals accepted by HDB, HDB will carry out the conversion of the MSCP roof decks into community/allotment gardens using our Prefabricated Extensive Green (PEG) Roof Tray System. In addition, if applicants wish to improve the completed gardens with other works e.g. setting up of rest areas for gardeners, wall/floor murals, etc , they can be supported with a funding of up to $20,000.

The Project Fund and Building Fund are open for applications throughout the year. Application should be submitted at least 8 weeks before the project start date. For MSCP Rooftop Gardening Proposals, applications are open from: March – April; and September – October

For MSCP Rooftop Gardening Proposals The application for MSCP rooftop gardening proposals is currently closed. The next application window will open from 1 March to 30 April 2026. The application form will be made available online from 1 March 2026 onwards, and all applicants will be notified via email on the outcomes of your submission in July 2026. For Project Fund and Building Fund Proposals Completing the grant application should take about 30 mins with all the information on hand. All fields are mandatory unless otherwise stated.

blurb: The Lively Places Fund (LPF) aims to support community-led efforts in enlivening Singapore's public spaces. Under this programme, you can organise activities in public spaces and streets that bring communities together, or create installations that enliven our public spaces. LPF

title: HARMONY FUND (HF)
agency: Ministry of Culture, Community and Youth

application.raw: The Harmony Fund is open for applications throughout the year. Applications should be submitted at least 8 weeks before the project start date.

snippets: In April 2013, MCCY launched the Harmony Fund to support ground-up initiatives that promote racial and religious harmony. The fund aims to facilitate people-sector initiatives that can complement Government efforts to nurture stronger bonds and build bridges between the different racial and religious communities. Over time, the Fund seeks to cultivate a mature citizenry that takes greater ownership in building a more cohesive Singapore. Who can apply? The grant is open to the following: Singaporean/PR individuals Non-profit organisations, and For-profit organisations registered in Singapore undertaking non-profit projects Please note that community centres and community development councils (CDCs) are not eligible for the grant. More details on eligibility are available in the grant guidelines . When can I apply? The Harmony Fund is open for applications throughout the year. Applications should be submitted at least 8 weeks before the project start date. How much funding can you receive? Successful applicant receives up to 80% of supporting project expenditure, capped at $100,000, on a reimbursement basis.
The Harmony Fund is open for applications throughout the year. Applications should be submitted at least 8 weeks before the project start date.

title: Love Our ’Hood Fund

application.raw: The application period is open throughout the year. All applications must be submitted at least eight weeks before the project start date to allow sufficient time for clarifications, processing, and administrative arrangements.

snippets: The Love Our ’Hood Fund supports projects that address municipal issues and/or foster a sense of community within the neighbourhood to manage neighbourly issues amicably. Some municipal issues include littering, irresponsible feeding of community animals, noise from neighbours and second-hand smoke. More details on the grant are available in the grant guidelines . Who can apply? For Individuals You must be a Singapore Citizen/Permanent Resident, who is 18 years old and above. You must be residing in Singapore. For Organisations The organisation must be: A company that is registered with the Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority (ACRA); or A not-for-profit organisation that is a Public Company Limited by guarantee registered with Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority (ACRA); or Society registered with Registry of Societies (ROS); or Charitable Trust registered with the Commissioner of Charities (COC); or Co-Operative registered with the Registry of Co-operative Societies; or Trade Union registered with Registry of Trade Unions. A company that is registered with the Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority (ACRA); or A not-for-profit organisation that is a Public Company Limited by guarantee registered with Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority (ACRA); or Society registered with Registry of Societies (ROS); or Charitable Trust registered with the Commissioner of Charities (COC); or Co-Operative registered with the Registry of Co-operative Societies; or Trade Union registered with Registry of Trade Unions. Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority (ACRA); or Society registered with Registry of Societies (ROS); or Charitable Trust registered with the Commissioner of Charities (COC); or Co-Operative registered with the Registry of Co-operative Societies; or Trade Union registered with Registry of Trade Unions. When can I apply? The application period is open throughout the year. All applications must be submitted at least eight weeks before the project start date to allow sufficient time for clarifications, processing, and administrative arrangements. How much funding can you receive? You may receive up to 80% of supported project expenditure on a reimbursement basis, capped at $20,000 per project. Specific funding levels would vary based on the merits of each project.

title: SUSTAIN THE ARTS (stART) FUND (ORGANISATION FUNDING)

application.raw: The Sustain The Arts (stART) Fund is open for application once a year. The 2026 cycle will be from 5th January 2026 to 27th February 2026.

blurb: The Sustain The Arts (stART) Fund provides funding to arts organisations to help scale-up and attain Charity and/or IPC status. Through the organisation funding, the stART Fund supports a broad range of operational needs and capacity building efforts in ensuring that eligible sma

title: SUSTAIN THE ARTS (stART) FUND (PROGRAMME FUNDING)

application.raw: The Sustain The Arts (stART) Fund is open for application once a year. The 2026 cycle will be from 5th January 2026 to 27th February 2026.

snippets: The Sustain The Arts (stART) Fund provides funding to arts organisations to help create and present quality programmes that contribute to the vibrancy of Singapore's arts and culture ecosystem. Such programmes include those with community impact that enable more people to enjoy the arts, enhance the arts experience through digital technology, and encourage audiences to reflect on and celebrate Singapore's cultural identity. Who can apply? Arts organisations who are registered with Commissioner of Charities (COC), Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority of Singapore (ACRA) or the Registry of Societies (ROS), and have total operating expenditure (TOE) of below $1M based on last audited financial statements. Arts organisations with Institution of Public Character (IPC) status with a TOE below $1M are eligible for the stART Fund programme track. However, they are only allowed to receive funding from the stART Fund for one cycle. When can I apply? The Sustain The Arts (stART) Fund is open for application once a year. The 2026 cycle will be from 5th January 2026 to 27th February 2026. How much funding can you receive? Successful applications to the Programme track may receive a fund quantum between $20,000 to $50,000.

blurb: The Sustain The Arts (stART) Fund provides funding to arts organisations to help create and present quality programmes that contribute to the vibrancy of Singapore's arts and culture ecosystem. Such programmes include those with community impact that enable more people to enjoy t

title: Charities Capability Fund - Training Grant (CCF)

application.raw: Charities may submit its applications at least 1 month before the commencement of the course to be considered for funding.

snippets: Training courses (local classroom-based courses and local/overseas online courses) for charities' board members and staff (who have served in the charities for at least 6 months with an official designation) in key governance and management areas. This includes courses on: Board Governance Conflict of Interest Strategic Planning Programme Management Human Resource and Volunteer Management Financial Management, Internal Controls, Risk Management Fundraising Practices Disclosure and Transparency Public Image/Communications Digitalisation/Data Protection/Cyber Security Leadership and Organisational Development Anti-Money Laundering/Countering the Financing of Terrorism Crisis Management, Business Continuity Planning Other training courses that are aimed at improving the governance and management aspects of charities. Who can Apply? All exempt, registered charities and IPCs can apply for the CCF Training Grant for its board members, staff and sub-committee members in key governance and management areas. Staff and sub-committee members should have completed at least six months of service with their respective charities. When to apply? Charities may submit its applications at least 1 month before the commencement of the course to be considered for funding. How much funding can you receive? For Singaporeans/Permanent Residents: Up to 80% of course fee, capped at $1,000 per course or $500/full-day (8hrs) or $250/half day (4hrs) per participant, whichever is lower. For Employment Pass/Work Permit Holders/S Pass Holders: Up to 60% of course fee, capped at $750 per course or $375/full-day (8hrs) or $187.50/half-day (4hrs) per participant, whichever is lower.

blurb:
Training courses (local classroom-based courses and local/overseas online courses) for charities' board members and staff (who have served in the charities for at least 6 months with an official designation) in key governance and management areas.
This includes courses on:
Board

title: Professional Capability Grant (Open Grant Call)

snippets: This category focuses on courses that will develop and retain talents in the social service sector, which includes short to mid-term local and overseas training courses as well as clinical supervision that will build the manpower capability of the SSAs. It also funds social service projects aimed at improving staff competencies and the Sabbatical Leave Scheme (SLS) that focuses on staff wellness. The five grants under PCG are: Overseas Training Grant The Overseas Training Grant supports short-term overseas training/ conference and study trip, that are not readily available in Singapore. It is open to NCSS-members Social Service Agencies and MSF-funded agencies. The staff must not be receiving other government funding. Local Training (non-pre-approval) The non-pre-approval funding supports short-term social service-related courses and conferences. It is open to NCSS-members Social Service Agencies and MSF-funded Agencies. The staff must not be receiving other government funding. Professional Development Sponsorship The Professional Development Sponsorships provides funding for in-service professionals to acquire their first recognised social work and psychology qualifications It also provides training subsidy for other social service-related graduate and post-graduate courses. Staff of NCSS member Social Service Agencies (SSAs) and/or MSF-funded agencies. The staff must not be receiving other government funding (except for the subsidy from Ministry of Education) for Graduate Diploma/Degree studies, unless specifically allowed. The staff must also not qualify for other schemes such as Career Conversion Programme (CCP) for social workers and has been accepted into an approved Bachelor/Graduate Diploma/ Masters programme. Open Grant The Open Grant supports clinical supervision, SSA-initiated and centrally driven initiatives, that build the professional capability of the SSA and its staff. It is open to NCSS-members Social Service Agencies and MSF-funded Agencies. The staff must not be receiving other government funding. Sabbatical Leave Scheme (SLS) The Sabbatical Leave Scheme (SLS) aims to provide social service professionals (who have at least 5 years of direct work experience in their respective professional fields within the sector) with 10 weeks of paid leave to recharge and refresh themselves. It is open to social service professionals who are registered social workers, occupational therapists, physiotherapists, speech therapists, psychologists, counsellors and EPIC teachers with Advanced Diploma in Early Childhood Intervention (Special Needs) Please refer to the website for more information.

blurb: This category focuses on courses that will develop and retain talents in the social service sector, which includes short to mid-term local and overseas training courses as well as clinical supervision that will build the manpower capability of the SSAs. It also funds social servi

title: SG60 Towards Sustainability Fund

application.raw: From 19 September 2025 to 31 March 2026.

snippets: As we celebrate SG60, the SG60 Towards Sustainability Fund aims to recognise the contributions of social service agencies (SSAs) to Singapore. It supports SSAs in taking first steps to building critical capabilities in measuring, monitoring, and reporting the effectiveness of their programmes with the goal of improving the quality of lives of individuals and families they serve. Stronger outcomes reporting will also enable SSAs to scale high-impact programmes and attract more resources from funders. Who can apply? NCSS Full Members who can meet the requirements of this fund. Funding Requirements Be a NCSS Full Member Provide information of the identified programme not funded by any government agency and submit the Theory of Change (TOC). The programme criteria are: Provides direct intervention to service users, i.e. structured services with a clear start and end points to achieve specific client outcomes Programme identified has the highest total expenditure, among all the other programmes and/or serves the largest number of service users The programme serves at least one of ComChest’s 5 causes which are Adults with Disabilities, Children with Special Needs & Youth-At-Risk, Families in Need of Assistance, People with Mental Health Conditions and Seniors in Need of Support Agency must commit to share outcome data with NCSS should agency be further supported in other funding (e.g. Transformation Sustainability Scheme) to strengthen programme evaluation capabilities Agency must send at least one representative to attend a session organised by NCSS on how better impact measurement can help to attract more resources from funders When can I apply? From 19 September 2025 to 31 March 2026. How much funding can you receive? $30,000.00

blurb: As we celebrate SG60, the SG60 Towards Sustainability Fund aims to recognise the contributions of social service agencies (SSAs) to Singapore. It supports SSAs in taking first steps to building critical capabilities in measuring, monitoring, and reporting the effectiveness of the

title: Asia-Ready Exposure Programme (AEP)

application.raw: Application is open throughout the year. Application should be submitted at least 3 months before the proposed AEP Project Start Date. Applicants who require assistance to fine-tune their proposals are encouraged to send the AEP proposal to AEP_enquiries@nyc.gov.sg before the 3 months submission timeline and factor in adequate time to amend the proposal.

snippets: The Asia-Ready Exposure Programme (AEP) supports educational institutions based and registered in Singapore to provide youths with opportunities to gain industry and cultural exposure to ASEAN member states, China and/or India (ACI). The AEP aims to: Increase youth awareness and understanding of the social, cultural and political dimensions of the ACI cities; Increase awareness of the economic growth trajectories and opportunities in the ACI markets; and Broaden personal growth opportunities and youth ACI networks. Interested applicants are to read the AEP Factsheet and FAQ , complete the online application and submit the required documents to NYC at least 3 months before the proposed AEP Project Start Date. Who Can Apply? Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs, e.g. Institute of Technical Education, Polytechnic, University, Private Education Institution, Madrasah) based and registered in Singapore When to Apply? Application is open throughout the year. Application should be submitted at least 3 months before the proposed AEP Project Start Date. Applicants who require assistance to fine-tune their proposals are encouraged to send the AEP proposal to AEP_enquiries@nyc.gov.sg before the 3 months submission timeline and factor in adequate time to amend the proposal. How much funding can you receive? Up to S$1,000 per eligible youth, subject to a grant cap* per institution per financial year *confirmed annually on a case-by-case basis Eligible youths refer to youths who meet all 4 criteria below: 15 to 35 years old; Singapore Citizens or Singapore Permanent Residents (PR); Currently studying in Institutes of Higher Learning (e.g. ITE Colleges, Polytechnics, Universities, Private Education Institutions, Madrasah etc.); and Have not been funded under the same life stage (i.e. education level) before. The grant will generally be disbursed in two tranches, depending on the duration of the project and other consideration factors. The remaining grant will be disbursed upon fulfilment of the deliverables and receipt of satisfactory report(s) of the project.

Application is open throughout the year. Application should be submitted at least 3 months before the proposed AEP Project Start Date. Applicants who require assistance to fine-tune their proposals are encouraged to send the AEP proposal to AEP_enquiries@nyc.gov.sg before the 3 months submission timeline and factor in adequate time to amend the proposal.

Up to S$1,000 per eligible youth, subject to a grant cap* per institution per financial year *confirmed annually on a case-by-case basis Eligible youths refer to youths who meet all 4 criteria below: 15 to 35 years old; Singapore Citizens or Singapore Permanent Residents (PR); Currently studying in Institutes of Higher Learning (e.g. ITE Colleges, Polytechnics, Universities, Private Education Institutions, Madrasah etc.); and Have not been funded under the same life stage (i.e. education level) before. The grant will generally be disbursed in two tranches, depending on the duration of the project and other consideration factors. The remaining grant will be disbursed upon fulfilment of the deliverables and receipt of satisfactory report(s) of the project.

blurb:
The Asia-Ready Exposure Programme (AEP) supports educational institutions based and registered in Singapore to provide youths with opportunities to gain industry and cultural exposure to ASEAN member states, China and/or India (ACI).
The AEP aims to:
Increase youth awareness and

title: Pay-It-Forward Award

application.raw: Leaders may start applying for PIFA from the date of conferment at the Youth Corps Leaders Commencement Ceremony. Application is open throughout the year and must be submitted at least 8 weeks before project commencement date.

snippets: The Pay-It-Forward Award (PIFA), administered by Youth Corps Singapore, is a project grant awarded to each conferred leader to initiate and sustain ground-up initiatives that serve the local community. The grant aims to enable Youth Corps Leaders to continue contributing to the local community after graduating from the Youth Corps Leaders Programme. PIFA can be used to: Organise youth events/ground-up initiatives; and Mentor/advise/lead and sponsor other youths for community projects. Note: Project must not contain any inflammatory and/or discriminatory elements that may disrupt societal, racial and religious harmony. Interested applicants are to read the PIFA Funding Guidelines , complete the online application and submit the required documents to NYC at least 8 weeks before the proposed Project Start Date. Who Can Apply? Leaders who have been successfully conferred upon completing Youth Corps Singapore Leaders Programme Cluster Leaders who have been successfully conferred Within 3 years from the date of conferment, Leaders may apply for PIFA as an individual or a team When to Apply? Leaders may start applying for PIFA from the date of conferment at the Youth Corps Leaders Commencement Ceremony. Application is open throughout the year and must be submitted at least 8 weeks before project commencement date. How much funding can you receive? Each successful applicant will receive up to $3,000 in funding (i.e., if the Leader was previously awarded $2,000 for a past project initiative, the Leader will only be able to apply for up to $1,000 for current project). A team of more than three Youth Corps Leaders with a combined PIFA of $10,000 or more may apply for up to $10,000 for their project initiative.

Leaders may start applying for PIFA from the date of conferment at the Youth Corps Leaders Commencement Ceremony. Application is open throughout the year and must be submitted at least 8 weeks before project commencement date.

blurb: The Pay-It-Forward Award (PIFA), administered by Youth Corps Singapore, is a project grant awarded to each conferred leader to initiate and sustain ground-up initiatives that serve the local community. The grant aims to enable Youth Corps Leaders to continue contributing to the l

title: Programme X Fund

application.raw: Interested applicants should review the Funding Guidelines and submit their online application with the required documents through the OurSG Grants portal. Applications must be submitted at least 8 weeks before the proposed project start date.

snippets: Programme X is a programme launched in 2019 by Youth Corps Singapore (YCS) in partnership with the Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs) to promote youth volunteerism and develop the next generation of youth community service leaders. The ‘X’ stands for Multiplier, and the mission is to raise up youth Multipliers to rally and lead their peers in their charge to create a positive impact on the community. This is in response to changing and unmet social needs, which requires volunteers to step up to play an active role in coming alongside Social Service Agencies (SSAs) to tackle these issues and needs. Who can apply? Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents (PR) who have participated in Programme X, within one year of their participation, and are multipliers. Applicants must complete the 'Successful Funding Application' module on LMS When can I apply? Interested applicants should review the Funding Guidelines and submit their online application with the required documents through the OurSG Grants portal. Applications must be submitted at least 8 weeks before the proposed project start date. How much funding can you receive? Successful applicants will receive an in-principle fund approval of up to $3,000 or 100% of the total allowable project cost, whichever is lower.

Interested applicants should review the Funding Guidelines and submit their online application with the required documents through the OurSG Grants portal. Applications must be submitted at least 8 weeks before the proposed project start date.

The ‘X’ stands for Multiplier, and the mission

title: Youth Corps Affiliate Project Grant (YCAF)

application.raw: Interested applicants should review the Funding Guidelines and submit their online application with the required documents through the OurSG Grants portal. Applications must be submitted at least 8 weeks before the proposed project start date.

snippets: The Youth Corps Affiliate Project Grant, administered by Youth Corps Singapore, is a funding initiative that supports Affiliate-led projects serving the Singapore community and society. The grant enables young changemakers to initiate and sustain ground-up initiatives that drive positive change. Successful applicants will receive funding to implement their proposed projects. Who can apply? Affiliates (EXCO team) who have been successfully appointed and are currently part of the Youth Corps Affiliate Scheme. Affiliates may apply anytime within their 3-year appointment term. When can I apply? Interested applicants should review the Funding Guidelines and submit their online application with the required documents through the OurSG Grants portal. Applications must be submitted at least 8 weeks before the proposed project start date. How much funding can you receive? Funding up to 100% of total allowed project costs, up to $3,000 per project, with a maximum of two projects funded per financial year (1 Apr – 31 Mar).

Interested applicants should review the Funding Guidelines and submit their online application with the required documents through the OurSG Grants portal. Applications must be submitted at least 8 weeks before the proposed project start date.

title: Youth Corps Cluster Project Grant (YCCL)

application.raw: Application is open throughout the year. Applicants should review the Funding Guidelines and ensure their application, along with all required documents, is submitted at least 8 weeks before the proposed project start date.

snippets: The Youth Corps Cluster Project Grant, administered by Youth Corps Singapore, is a funding initiative that supports youth-led projects serving the Singapore community and society. The grant enables Cluster youth to initiate and sustain ground-up initiatives that drive positive change. Successful applicants will receive funding to implement their proposed projects. Who can apply? Cluster members who are currently part of the Youth Corps Cluster Network. Project must be endorsed by the Youth Corps Staff Cluster Lead. When can I apply? Application is open throughout the year. Applicants should review the Funding Guidelines and ensure their application, along with all required documents, is submitted at least 8 weeks before the proposed project start date. How much funding can you receive? For each project, successful applicants may receive up to $3,000 or up to 100% of supported costs, whichever is lower. Each Cluster may apply for funding for up to three projects per year.

Application is open throughout the year. Applicants should review the Funding Guidelines and ensure their application, along with all required documents, is submitted at least 8 weeks before the proposed project start date.

blurb: The Youth Corps Cluster Project Grant, administered by Youth Corps Singapore, is a funding initiative that supports youth-led projects serving the Singapore community and society. The grant enables Cluster youth to initiate and sustain ground-up initiatives that drive positive ch

title: YOUNG CHANGEMAKERS (YCM)

application.raw: Application is open throughout the year and must be submitted at least 8 weeks before 1st Saturday of project implementation month.

snippets: Have a cool idea that can contribute to the community? The Young ChangeMakers Grant supports youth-initiated projects that benefit the Singapore community and society. It also helps to empower youth as decision makers to evaluate projects and mentor project applicants. Who can apply? Singaporean or Singaporean Permanent Residents (PR) youths residing locally between 15 – 35 years old by birth year. When can I apply? Application is open throughout the year and must be submitted at least 8 weeks before 1st Saturday of project implementation month. How much funding can I receive? Successful applicants will receive an in-principle grant approval of up to $3,000 or up to 100% of supported cost, whichever is lower. Projects that demonstrate exceeding merits in terms of project scale and impact will be awarded up to $5,000 or up to 100% of supported cost, whichever is lower. Download the YCM Factsheet to find out more about the YCM Grant: For applications before 1st August 2024, please click here For applications from 1st August 2024, please click here Embarking on a youth-led Heritage project? Co-presented by the NYC YCM and National Heritage Board (NHB), the Young ChangeMakers – Youth Heritage Kickstarter Fund (YCM – YHKF) offers additional funding and resources to empower youths to take an active role in preserving and safeguarding Singapore’s heritage. If you wish to promote the appreciation and understanding of Singapore’s heritage, you may be funded up to $5,000 or $7,000 to kickstart your project! To find out more about the YCM – YHKF, check out the factsheet here . Interested and eligible applicants can apply to the YCM – YHKF via the YCM grant card (this page) and select ‘Culture & Heritage’ as the project category. Embarking on a youth-led sporting initiative? The Young ChangeMakers - YouthCreates (Sport) grant, jointly offered by the NYC YCM and SportSG YouthCreates, can help bring your ideas to life! Projects that reach out and engage the community through sporting or physical activities could receive funding of up to $6,000 or $8,000. Ready to make a difference to the community through sports? Find out more about the YCM - YC (Sport) grant here , and submit your application through the YCM grant card (this page) and select 'Sport' as your project category. Embarking on a youth-led Bilingualism project? In partnership with the Lee Kuan Yew Fund for Bilingualism, the Young ChangeMakers – Bilingualism grant offers additional funding for youths to promote bilingualism. If you are keen to promote bilingualism and encourage the usage of both English and Mother Tongue languages in daily lives, you may be funded up to $6,000 or $8,000 to kickstart your project! Find out more about the YCM – Bilingualism grant here and apply via the YCM grant card (this page). Got a brilliant idea for public transport? The Young ChangeMakers - Caring SG Commuters grant in collaboration with the Public Transport Council (PTC) is here to empower young innovators like you to create a more gracious, caring and inclusive commuting experience for everyone! Score up to $5,000 for your project (or even $7,000 if your idea is next-level) and turn your vision to reality. Whether you are dreaming up creative campaigns, designing inclusive solutions, or building stronger community vibes on our trains and buses, this grant is your launchpad. Find out more about the YCM - Caring SG Commuters grant here and apply via the YCM grant card (this page) to make a difference today because the best ideas come from everyday commuters like you! For queries about the YCM grant, you may contact our friendly grant managers at partnership_enquiries@nyc.gov.sg.
Application is open throughout the year and must be submitted at least 8 weeks before 1st Saturday of project implementation month.

blurb:
Have a cool idea that can contribute to the community? The Young ChangeMakers Grant supports youth-initiated projects that benefit the Singapore community and society. It also helps to empower youth as decision makers to evaluate projects and mentor project applicants.

title: Youth Expedition Project Goes Online (YEP-GO)

application.raw: Application should be submitted at least 2 months before the start of the Online Project.

snippets: YEP-GO provides a platform for youths to continue volunteering with the overseas communities without travel. Youths can connect with overseas partner organisations to develop programmes such as online classes, trainings or skilled volunteering through virtual means. A YEP-GO project should: Involve communities in the ASEAN member states, India and China; Be endorsed by an Endorsing Organisation (EO) which is a recognised education institution or not-for-profit organisation based and registered in Singapore; Complete three key phases, i.e. Preparation, Online Project and Project Closure. Who can apply? Anyone in the team can submit the application: Team Leader must be Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident (PR); At least 80% of team, including Team Leader, must be Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident (PR); Team Member has to be between 15 – 35 years old. More details on eligibility are available in the grant guidelines . When can I apply? Application should be submitted at least 2 months before the start of the Online Project. How much funding can you receive? Successful applicants will receive 80% of total qualifying project costs, capped at $3,000 per team.
Application should be submitted at least 2 months before the start of the Online Project.

blurb:
YEP-GO provides a platform for youths to continue volunteering with the overseas communities without travel. Youths can connect with overseas partner organisations to develop programmes such as online classes, trainings or skilled volunteering through virtual means.
A YEP-GO proj

title: OUR SINGAPORE FUND (Community)
agency: Ministry of Culture, Community and Youth

application.raw: Our Singapore Fund is open for applications throughout the year. Applications must be submitted at least 8 weeks before the project start date.

snippets: Our Singapore Fund (Community) supports meaningful citizen-led projects that strengthens our solidarity as a society through three main themes: Belong: Projects whose content and participant engagement help participants build an appreciation of Singapore’s shared values and a sense of belonging to Singapore. Build: Projects which encourage participants to contribute to community needs and/or the social good. Bond: Projects which bring different groups/communities together to build mutual understanding and respect. Who can apply? For individuals You must be a Singapore Citizen/Permanent Resident who is 18 years old and above and residing in Singapore. SingPass will be required to log into the Our SG Grants portal to submit an application. For groups For organisation and companies The organisation or company must be registered in Singapore. CorpPass will be required to log into the Our SG Grants portal to submit an application. Contact person/ applicant must be a Singapore Citizen/Permanent Resident who is 18 years old and above and residing in Singapore. For schools/ youth groups The applicant must be a staff of the school/member of the youth group (a Singapore Citizen/Permanent Resident who is 18 years old and above and residing in Singapore) Corppass. Unregistered youth groups may apply as an individual however, please state the name and status of the youth group clearly in the application Note that OSF(C) does not support projects which are part of the education curriculum. When can I apply? Our Singapore Fund is open for applications throughout the year. Applications must be submitted at least 8 weeks before the project start date. How much funding can you receive? Successful applicants can receive up to 50% or 80% of supported project expenditure, capped at $20,000.00. Specific funding levels would vary based on the project's alignment to OSF(C) objectives. Although funding for projects is capped at $20,000.00, your awarded grant may be less than $20,000.00, subject to project merit, actual expenditures, and assessed qualifying cost etc. Does my project meet OSF(C)'s requirements? To find out if your project meets OSF(C)'s eligibility, funding requirements and objectives please complete the Applicant checklist before submitting your application. More details are available in the FAQs .
Our Singapore Fund is open for applications throughout the year. Applications must be submitted at least 8 weeks before the project start date.

Successful applicants can receive up to 50% or 80% of supported project expenditure, capped at $20,000.00. Specific funding levels would vary based on the project's alignment to OSF(C) objectives. Although funding for projects is capped at $20,000.00, your awarded grant may be less than $20,000.00, subject to project merit, actual expenditures, and assessed qualifying cost etc.

title: NYF (Research Grant)

application.raw: Application is open throughout the year and must be submitted at least 2 months before the start of your project.

snippets: The $100 million National Youth Fund (NYF) encourages and supports ground-up youth initiatives and innovations that benefit the community. Who can apply? Youth or youth leaders who have a strong record of community involvement may apply. Applicants must be Singaporean or Singaporean Permanent Residents, aged 15 – 35 years. Youth sector organisations, youth social enterprises, schools and Institutes of Higher Learning (i.e. Institutes of Technical Education, Polytechnics and Universities). More details on eligibility are available in the grant guidelines . When can I apply? Application is open throughout the year and must be submitted at least 2 months before the start of your project. How much funding can you receive? Successful applicants will receive up to 80% of the total allowable project cost for each project by an organisation/school/IHL/individual youths.
Application is open throughout the year and must be submitted at least 2 months before the start of your project.

title: Active Citizen Grant

application.raw: All year round for Team Nila, Team Singapore & YouthCreates.

snippets: We support community sporting events/projects that fulfil any of the following objectives: Engage the community with meaningful and impactful volunteering opportunities. Demonstrate innovative ways of engaging and inspiring the community through sport, physical activity or health & wellness initiatives. Incorporate elements of “Care” that contribute towards building a caring society e.g. by providing opportunities for social mixing among different groups, offering volunteering platforms for the community to give back to society, rallying participation and contribution behind a good cause. Who can apply? Anyone can apply, but Team Nila projects should promote/involve sport volunteerism, while YouthCreates projects should support youth-led sporting initiatives and Team Singapore projects should strengthen affinity for Team Singapore athletes. More details on eligibility are available in the grant guidelines . When can I apply? All year round for Team Nila, Team Singapore & YouthCreates. How much funding can you receive? YouthCreates, Team Nila & Team Singapore are capped at $20,000.

title: Tote Board Arts Fund

application.raw: Applications must reach Tote Board Arts Fund Secretariat before commencement of your project. Check key dates and application windows for more information.

title: WECARE ARTS FUND (WCAF)
agency: Community Development Council - National Arts Council

application.raw: The Fund is open for applications all year round, but you should submit your application 8 weeks before your project is set to take place.

snippets: WeCare Arts Fund (WCAF) supports Social Service Agencies (SSAs) in engaging their beneficiaries through the arts in the form of workshops, or performances and exhibitions co-created with professional artists. Who can apply? Supported projects must be organised by local arts agencies/Singaporean or Permanent Resident artists in conjunction with non-profit SSAs registered with the National Council of Social Service. More details on eligibility are available in the grant guidelines . When can I apply? The Fund is open for applications all year round, but you should submit your application 8 weeks before your project is set to take place. How much funding can you receive? The Fund supports up to $5,000 per project, covering qualifying costs and direct expenses like artist fees and art materials.
The Fund is open for applications all year round, but you should submit your application 8 weeks before your project is set to take place.

title: Youth Corps Expedition Project

application.raw: The preparation phase may take 3 to 5 months to complete. You should start the planning process early and apply no later than 2 months before the start date of your YEP Overseas Project to be considered for funding. Ensure you have the following required documents ready when you submit your application.

snippets: Youth Corps Expedition Project (YEP) is a Service-Learning programme by Youth Corps Singapore to nurture confident and resilient youths who are active citizens with the desire to make a difference both at home and overseas. YEP involves communities in Asia with a focus on the ASEAN member states, China or India. The grant supports youths endorsed by educational institutions and not-for-profit organisation based and registered in Singapore to embark on community building projects, leadership and project management training within the programme. For more information on funding and eligibility, read the grant guidelines . Who can apply? Anyone in the team can submit the application: Team Leader must be Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident (PR); At least 80% of team, including Team Leader, must be Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident (PR); Team Member has to be between 15 – 35 years old. More details on eligibility are available in the grant guidelines . How much funding can you receive? YEP teams can receive funding for up to 60% of total allowable projects costs, subject to a cap of S$1,000 per pax per eligible participant. When to apply? The preparation phase may take 3 to 5 months to complete. You should start the planning process early and apply no later than 2 months before the start date of your YEP Overseas Project to be considered for funding. Ensure you have the following required documents ready when you submit your application. How can you check if participants are eligible for funding? Start a new application for your project and fill in the team name list to see which participants are eligible for YEP funding. You can repeat this step as many times as you need, before submitting the application.

The preparation phase may take 3 to 5 months to complete. You should start the planning process early and apply no later than 2 months before the start date of your YEP Overseas Project to be considered for funding. Ensure you have the following required documents ready when you submit your application.
